website_summaries.verdict: By far one of the most popular hand grips on the market, this product delivers in supreme quality and stability.
pros: Three finger grip offers overall hand coverage, but can also be ordered as a two finger product
cons: Velcro wrist straps have a tendency to break with overuse

customer_reviews.title: Two Sets Broken!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my husband did not have much luck with these. We ordered one pair and took them to a competition and let a friend borrow them and they broke within five minutes. My husband had only owned them for a week at that point. He went ahead and ordered a second pair thinking they would be better this go around and the others were just a fluke. He wore those at ONE competition and they snapped. We typically do not write reviews but after having two pairs break we felt it was only common courtesy to pass along the information.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Best leather grips I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Any legitimate crossfitter knows that when purchasing hand grips one should always seek out premium leather products. That is exactly what I found here with Bear KompleX Three Hole hand grips. I have tried two other brands, only for them to bear useless after about 5 months of daily use. This is a fantastic startup company with great service and I highly advise people (specifically those who's hands tear on BMUs or RMUs). Make sure you take your measurements correctly, get the leather version, and don't freak out when they feel "tight" before they are worn in. It took about three workouts for them to fit like an ol baseball mit. Again, great company and awesome leather product.
customer_reviews.author: Bryson Randall

customer_reviews.title: Product looked great and felt like a high quality product but felt ...
customer_reviews.text: Prompt delivery as a prime member. Product looked great and felt like a high quality product but felt a little stiff. Not a problem, of course, I knew I'd need to use it a couple times to break it in. However, on the SECOND time using this product the wrist strap ripped in half as I tried to take it off and now its useless since I can't fasten it around my wrist. Really wanted to like this product because of all the good reviews but might have to keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Riza Celine A. Fabreo

customer_reviews.title: 2nd pair, 1st pair broke
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I really like them, the Velcro strap broke on the first pair while max deadlifting (my fault), so I bought the second pair immediately. I was not satisfied with one of the grips is received on my second order, but they replaced it immediately. Great product and great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but don't break in and leather too thick
customer_reviews.text: Ehh... quality is great, looks great, no issue with strap digging intro wrist BUT these just don't break in. I've used these for nearly 2 months in various WODs but (see pic) still smooth leather. Needs lots of chalk. Also leather is really thick. Had to switch my grip on pull ups to thumb underneath, used to be able to keep thumb on top with my old grips (wrist strap broke). NOTE: another girl in my box has these in black, might be an old version idk but both sides are like the suede leather and not so thick, she loves them. That would be so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Rjoyw

customer_reviews.title: Great leather grips - I just wish the composite were available through Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of the composite Bear Komplex grips (you can get them on their website but not on Amazon yet) but I somehow lost of the grips so I decided to try the Emerge Fitness wraps. I tried them on - once - and decided to get another pair of the Bear Komplex grips - haha. I use the grips primarily for pullups in my WOD's - but I also use them from time to time for weightlifting - especially if I just tore my hands up from pullups.
customer_reviews.author: MatthewW

customer_reviews.title: And it got good reviews. So I bought them
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughter for gymnastics. We bought grips from the gymnastics place and were not made well.daughter said it hurt her wrist .so I found these grips on Amazon. And it got good reviews. So I bought them. Arrived on time .my daughter LOVES THEM !!!.THESE GRIPS ARE MADE TO LAST. VERY WELL MADE.WOULD LOVE TO GET HER ALL THE COLORS. BUT MONEY IS TIGHT RIGHT NOW. THANKS Bear K ompleX .
customer_reviews.author: Grateful 89

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great construction and quality. The issue is they’re uncomfortable for me when I grip the bar. They continue to curl under the bar between my hand and finger, the meaty part, if you will. I’ve had them for some time, and still don’t feel right to me. I do have a wide hand, I did follow the measuring instructions, but still don’t feel right to me. I’ll wait to see if they come out with a fingerless product.
customer_reviews.author: adrian

customer_reviews.title: Go for the carbon comp instead
customer_reviews.text: The leather is very soft and pliable right away which is nice. But the grips are very slippery on the bar unless you have q huge amount if chalk, and the roll that many athletes rely on near the base of the fingers keeps happening mid palm which makes gripping harder, Did 3 muscle up and thought I was going to slip off every time. Chin ups were.... OK. But far from secure. I have another pair of the carbon comp grips and they are absolutely amazing. Highly recommend those instead of these plain leather.
customer_reviews.author: MrNeko

customer_reviews.title: Discoloration
customer_reviews.text: So after using a couple of time this is happening every time I ware them, my hands end up all black and it won't come off for a least 2 days, I don't know if the product is defective or if it is normal
customer_reviews.author: jose alarcon

customer_reviews.title: Best grip on the market!  Better for soft hands.  Bear Komplex 2 hole probably better for muscle ups
customer_reviews.text: All bear komplex grips are the best on the market. Sturdy, long lasting, and a bargain considering the quality. I will say, for muscle ups, I prefer the 2 hole hand grip. The three hole can bunch up a bit when your hand is rotating over the bar. For pullups and toes to bar, though, the 3 hole is fine and maybe even better if you really want to keep your hands soft or if you're tearing on your pointer pad. Cannot recommend highly enough but if you're a bit more advanced and your hands are toughened up a bit, I would recommend the 2 hole.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan K.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these grips because of the weather making the pull-up bar feel cold. They are soft on the hands and make gripping the bar for pull-ups and toes to bar a lot easier. My hands no longer look like a warzone after practicing bar work. I have issues with my wrists due to years of working on the computer and these grips secure the wrist as well so it makes the transition from doing bar work to barbell work easy. As someone whose goal is to improve bar work, these grips will assist in the process.
customer_reviews.author: Arleta

customer_reviews.title: but they were not comfortable enough for me to take the time to do ...
customer_reviews.text: These were too big for my small hands and bunched up. I would start off a wod with them and rip them off a few rounds in, defeating the purpose of grips. Maybe they take a little longer to break in, but they were not comfortable enough for me to take the time to do it. Also the black stained my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Wannabe Julia C

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong w/ these!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband. He does crossfit so he's constantly lifting weights and doing crazy moves on the bar. I got these for him because his skin was constantly peeling and I was getting grossed out on how his hands were looking. He can't say enough great things about these hand grips. He's only been using them for a couple weeks but can definitely tell the difference on how well they work. These are a must buy for fellow cross fitters or any gym enthusiast who lifts weights. Can't go wrong with these!
customer_reviews.author: Hani

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, I tried another product previously that had thicker wrist starps and 3 finger holes, I thought I would like the thicker wrist straps since I have a problem with my left wrist. I found that it was too much wrist support, almost preventing me from moving them as freely as I needed to. Bear Komplex leather wraps are awesome! I love the leather as well, I feel like when my hands start getting sweaty the leather doesn't slide around my palms as much as the rubber material. I will be buying another pair when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Hartmann

customer_reviews.title: Save your hands, get these.
customer_reviews.text: The break in period is a little rough but once you are there, these grips are awesome. The wrist strap also functions as a support so that’s really handy. I chose the brown leather palms but if I had to do it over again I would probably go with the black, since the leather is softer (more like suede) but it probably won’t last as long as the tougher brown leather. I’m new to CrossFit and lifting so it may have been a good idea to go with the grips that are easier on your hands. Now that I’ve broken in the grips I just love them. I bought size small and it’s perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Get ready to break these in!!!
customer_reviews.text: So I do crossfit and someone at my box had these so I thought I would try them they look very sturdy the leather is very thick but being thick leather they need to be worn in I've only worn them twice but took them off mid workout just because they were so hard to use I think if I just wore them here and there eventually they'll get worn in but I feel like it's gonna take a while
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Grips
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like the three hole grips. Covers the entire hand. If you have large fingers getting them off and on may be a little tough but not at all terrible. Wrist straps are fantastic and Velcro is great. I will be buying more for sure.
customer_reviews.author: William Brooks

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy the cheap knockoffs. I use this for my WOD's for pullups and toes to bar. They cant be beat for the price. I had a friend try to save the 12 bucks on a cheaper pair and he immediately regretted it. These are top quality for the cost. I lost 1 of my 1st pair and immediately without question came back to this brand and repurchased. Usually I'll go shop around d again for stuff to see if I changed my mind. But theres no dou t in these. They are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for much more
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice hand grips. I've used them for one workout so far and I like these better than any other grips I have tried. They are a great thickness that does not weaken your grip. The leather is strong and was great with little chalk. The velcro closures are well attached. The three-hole grip does great with keeping the grips in place and they don't move around a bunch. I will definitely be buying these grips again.
customer_reviews.author: M2Woodcrafts

customer_reviews.title: okay-ish grips
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I don't love these. I would rather have these than nothing on, but I still rip and still get blisters. I think its because they are super thick. almost too thick to get a good grip. I ordered these because of the shipping and they were cheaper than roo grips.. but will be ordering the roo grips after all!
customer_reviews.author: kevin riche

customer_reviews.title: My favorite grips!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite grips! I have tried quite a few other styles of grips and these Bear Komplex ones are my favorite. They are easy to get in and out of and save my hands on pull up, muscle ups and toes to bar. I was not sure if I would like the 2 hole or 3 hole better, I am pretty sure the 3 hole option was the best for me. They do take a few days/workouts to break in but that is as expected . Size was spot on for me. Very happy with these after being disappointed with other brands and styles of hand grips.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kreitner

customer_reviews.title: They're okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because others at my gym have them. They're okay. Not really comfortable (but not the worst). I bought a different pair that are cushioned and they are fabulous. I wouldn't purchase these again, but not for lack of quality. I'm just not a fan of this style. Still, they work fine and I keep them in my bag as a back-up pair in case I forget my others.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE
customer_reviews.text: stiff at first, was worried i wouldnt like the big finger holes but after only a couple uses i love them... hands havent ripped since but i did get a little raw spot on wrist after a workout. also the leather leaves a black wring around my fingers and wrist but i am sure once they are used enough it will stop. overall pleased with my purchase and would purchase again if ever need be. may try the two hole next time.
customer_reviews.author: Erin stuckey

customer_reviews.title: Love them for CrossFit!
customer_reviews.text: I love these grips; they are way better quality than others I have bought in the past. I cannot survive hanging on the bar without them -- that's how sensitive my hands are; with them I can do lots of reps of toes to bar or pull-ups with no issues. My only feedback is that I do get a little black on my wrists, maybe it's the dye coming off a bit. But it hasn't gotten on my clothes or anything so that's good.
customer_reviews.author: TheGarvs

customer_reviews.title: Everyone recommended spending the money and buying Bear KompleX grips but ...
customer_reviews.text: This makes 3rd pair of gymnastic grips but my first pair of Bear KompleX. Everyone recommended spending the money and buying Bear KompleX grips but I wasn't sure I would even like wearing grips. I bought two cheaper pairs and both ripped apart within 2 workouts. The difference in Bear grips is that they are one piece so they won't tear at the wrist. I have used the Bear once since I purchased them and they were comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Marcon, DC

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for crossfit
customer_reviews.text: I thought they were leather BUT pretty sure these (brown version) are the composite material because ive used them for a few months and they don't feel broken in like a friends who are definitely leather. Great for multiple bars. I am 6'4'' and good size hands and got the medium over the large and that was a good decision.
customer_reviews.author: Ibburnk18cnu

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: They are quite big, but work very well! I am a petite lady, 5'3 #140. It changed my grip on the rig from wrapped thumbs, to not wrapping my thumb, because if I get just the right grip, they Komplex's will actually create a cupping effect and helped my grip a lot. Love them, haven't ripped my hands yet!
customer_reviews.author: Colby

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, but overall value is not there.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the size as shown in the chart, and my fingers won’t fit through the holes. I cut the holes larger as best as I could - and pushed thru a few workouts to see how they would break in, and ended up getting blisters on my palms. Overall quality is good with thick leather and decent straps. Not terrible, just not the right ones for me.

customer_reviews.title: Great workout gloves
customer_reviews.text: I've been using classic weight lifting gloves for years now; you know the ones that look like cycling gloves but with padding. Having worn these gloves for just one workout, I'm a huge fan. For just being a meaty piece of leather and wrist straps, they are a huge difference in my workout. They offer a clean tight grip with enough padding to be comfortable but still allow you to feel the bar. The measurements and recommendation on sizes seem to be about right. I rounded down in size assuming they would stretch out and to avoid having too much material in my grip. They are definitely worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: DiZzmonster

customer_reviews.title: Overall great choice
customer_reviews.text: Fit great and felt great using. Only thing... i with there was somewhere the hold the hand wrap back when doing an exercise they aren't needed in and you don't have time to take them off and put back on again. Overall I would recommend though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They took the cheap route... sad
customer_reviews.text: Bear Komplex switched how they make their grips. They used to make them all one piece and now they take two pieces and sew them together at the wrist strap. They also cheapened up the Velcro piece and made that into two pieces and less quality material. Since these changes I have torn 3 pairs. They replaced each pair but it’s been a hassle. There are better quality made grips on the market now.
customer_reviews.author: NICK IN WISCONSIN

customer_reviews.title: best I've tried
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third set of grips. These seem the best so far. I've used them on pull-ups and heavy deadlift/power snatch. Nice feel in the hand. The straps are narrower so they don't pinch when you're wrists lockout in cleans or snatch/press. The palm pad is excellent. I have a feeling with use these will get better.
customer_reviews.author: KiwiTexan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good with these grips
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with these grips! They're working great. I ordered them in time to use for "Murph" this year. My hand had a small tear that was healing when I did Murph. The grips kept them from any further tears. I'm sure they'll just get better as the break in more. I used them again today for chest to bar pull-ups and they worked great! I measured with my hand stretched out (like in a push-up position), so I could keep them on during push-ups as well. I was right on the line and ordered up a size. They seem to be just fine. I'd be curious to try the next size down to see how they compare.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Hand Savers
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. Use them with any snatches of the Bar Bell, and any pull up related movements.I would always get nasty tares in my callouses are we approach summer due to the sweat, and this gloves has so far saved my hands so I can continue my weekly routine! If I had to purchase all over again, I would however purchase the 2 fingered gloves over the 3. This one tends to bother my small finger slightly. I used a workout partners 2 fingered gloves and they feel a little more natural. However, it may be that I am still breaking these in.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat the quality!
customer_reviews.text: These grips are awesome and comfortable at first try. During this break-in process I know they will become better. Love the fact that a sticker came with the package. I would prefer a total of two stickers so I can place them on my Jeep. I also have the Bear Komplex knee sleeves which help tremendously with my left knee pain. Bear Komplex products are recommended by my box owner and he stands by their products especially when the prices are reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Conquistador

customer_reviews.title: Finally NO Tearing!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many hand protectors in CrossFit that I was getting discouraged with all of my rips /tears. My hands are so fragile that regardless of how often I use them, they will never "harden up". Since using these, I haven't ripped once! Would highly recommend if you have trouble finding something that works!
customer_reviews.author: Alaina's Storefront

customer_reviews.title: Best out there!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! I am a crossfitter and my hands were getting torn apart from pull ups and lifting. Someone told me to buy this brand and i am so happy with my purchase. I have tried other brands and have slipped or not gotten a good enough grip. But these I dont have that problem and it completely protects my hands!
customer_reviews.author: michael j nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Love the grips
customer_reviews.text: I got these last week after ripping with my old grips. I had a competition coming up and I wanted something better to help keep my hands from shredding. I received them the day before and the first thing I noticed was how great they felt. The leather was soft and felt great when I wore them. I didn't break them at all and used them for a winter Murph and my hands felt great after even with the rips I had gotten a few days before. My hands measured at 4.5" but I got the large anyways and they fit perfect. The mediums would have been too small I think.
customer_reviews.author: Phil D.

customer_reviews.title: Velcro Fails After 4 Months
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two pairs and got them December 18, 2016. I ordered a third pair off another site and the results are the same. The Velcro is now failing on them.Overall the grips are great for preventing tears and seem designed to work best with WodWax but the fact that they are failing after 4 months is a downfall. Please be aware that these will prevents tears, and are phenomenal grips but do not last long before the Velcro fails.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thickness of the material
customer_reviews.text: My previous hand grips were very flimsy and the finger holes stretched badly. Because of that i never had any protection on my fingers. The Bear Komplex 3 material quality is much better. the finger holes dont stretch and the leather is very thick so you won't feel like you hands are still being pulled. Just the other week my cross-fit gym had a WOD that required 20 pulls every round (I got to the fourth round). My hands Never ripped. All I can say is that the straps that go around your wrist might leave a mark, but personally I would take a ring mark on my wrist than bloody blistered hands.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: I love my Bear Komplex Gloves!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very dedicated to bodybuilding and have calloused hands to prove it. The Bear gloves are the best weightlifting gloves I've ever owned, and believe me, I've owned many different brands over the years. I highly recommend this product. Provides an excellent grip and protects my hands. Plus the style is awesome. I have so many lifters asking about them!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. G

customer_reviews.title: Good grips, but the black dye gets on your hands.
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of grips for CrossFit, functionally they work and fit as promised. However the warnings about the dye bleeding onto your hands are true, it was pretty bad and my hands were stained for at least 24 hours. In hindsight I should’ve just waited and bought the bear komplex carbon fiber grips from rogue.com for the same price. My CrossFit coach said I should have washed them first, but I’m not sure how to go about that, any suggestions from the manufacturer on this? Maybe a label or washing instructions before first use should be created.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Elledge

customer_reviews.title: I love these
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. They cover the right part of the hand and are thin enough so you can get a good grip on the bar. I barely notice them when I'm working out. I have only been using them a week so I cant answer to the durability. I'll update after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Devious

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Smart Design.
customer_reviews.text: Great design. I would say that the design is so simple and yet effective. Gloves remove the feeling of control when you are handling kettle bells or barbells. Sizing may be off. I'm ordering a smaller size to verify. Update: I ordered a size smaller and it fits great. It's so effective at cushioning and provides great protection for your hands.
customer_reviews.author: CHAMOLATINO2000

customer_reviews.title: ... day and already noticed a huge difference between a crappy pair of gloves I bought for $20 and these ...
customer_reviews.text: First day and already noticed a huge difference between a crappy pair of gloves I bought for $20 and these bad boys. Man oh man, I feel like I can rip a phone book in half with these puppies on my paws. That's not what they're for but that's how good it feels to wear them! Ain't nobody got time for blisters and booboos. These are DEFINITELY some bear necessities my friends. GET YOU SOME!
customer_reviews.author: BCl3488

customer_reviews.title: Great with a rough bar!
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear either traditional half-finger gloves or no gloves at all (depends how rough the barbell is) so these definitely felt different. I thought I might have ordered the wrong size because the felt 'short' at first, but after talking with Jake at Bear Komplex, I took them for a spin with a WOD that included both barbell thrusters and burpees. These worked GREAT with my bar (which is quite rough) and did not interfere with the burpees at all. I'm looking forward to trying to wear them out, which seems like it could take a long long time!
customer_reviews.author: Mingo

customer_reviews.title: Size Matters
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE (3-hole large): It is a quality product. Great material. Comfortable. This version helps prevent tearing on my palm. I was in-between sizes and went to the larger size as instructed. This time I opted for the three-hole instead of two-hole. The extra material causes a small fold just below my fingers. Now, that’s where I tear. I would have returned them if not for getting blood on them. Two-hole: I returned these. When tightening the wrist wrap it pulls the leather to the side and exposes quite a bit of the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Got a size small according to measurements been using them for a month now and they have not broken in, gloves don’t stay in place unless you want to cut off circulation from your wrist, materials are good but still painful after a month not sure if this will change but do not recommend especially for this price and only a 1 month window to return is terrible
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Very Uncomfortable...
customer_reviews.text: The leather is quality, HOWEVER, these are some of the most uncomfortable gloves I've ever used. They never broke in lile the other reviews claimed they would. I'm a calisthenics athlete and I workout 4-5 days of the week/twice a day. I purchased a $10 pair of gloves from Academy Sports and they've lasted just as long and feel 10x better than these. Save yourself the money and get regular gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Christian N.

customer_reviews.title: Great grips
customer_reviews.text: Great quality grips. I bought these in the beginning of 2018 and they are still going strong. They do take a while to break in, but that isn't too big of a deal to me. I think I am going to try the carbon fiber grips next.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Which looks like they'll never tear
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't going to write a review till I encountered their customer service. I bought these because they looked indestructible. Their THICK. Which looks like they'll never tear. But I little eyelet did break and I contacted them and they replaced it no problem. Thank. You. I never run with these, especially with the three hole. They don't rip out of the bottom of the strap like other cheap wraps. Chalk the hell out of these though and or rough the leather up a little too. Thanks guys.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Grip!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with these grips. They are just the right amount of thickness, and provide good coverage. I especially like the way the wrist strap acts as a semi wrap. It provides subtle support, without feeling restrictive or bulky. The company has been great also, with communication on my purchase experience.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn D

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Have had these for a few days and they are loosening up well. My hands sweat a lot and I wanted to switch to the grips. They got a great test today during the Murph. No rips and my hands gripped well on the pull-up bar.
customer_reviews.author: scottnimrod

customer_reviews.title: Great Grips!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter for her birthday. She does Cross Fit 5 or 6 days a week. She loves these grips....says they prevent blisters 100%! I definitely would recommend them to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Theo Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Take care of your hands!
customer_reviews.text: Ive been looking for good hand grips for my crossfit workouts fpr awhile now and tried several other brands that didn't work well. Bear Komplex brand was recommended to me by my crossfit coaches who also use this brand. So fAR I've used them only for heavy lifting. Im hoping that pullups and toes to bar wont be as painful now with the gloves on. I like the quality of the material and prefer the 3-holes instead of 2 because the grip covers a bigger surface area of my palm and therefore provides greater protection from ripping calluses on the palms.
customer_reviews.author: dasha

customer_reviews.title: Bought to help with callus issue
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my Bear KompleX 3 Hole Leather Hand Grips to help with the callus problem I was having while trying to complete the Simple and Sinister program. After one workout I am callus free but will have to check back in to see if the product withstands the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Danimal

customer_reviews.title: When I first received the product I was disappointed to see I had been sent the wrong product
customer_reviews.text: When I first received the product I was disappointed to see I had been sent the wrong product. But I emailed the company and received a prompt response. They apologized and said they would be sending the right product to me that day. Two days later I had the right product in my hands. I have used them and they are great!!! They protect my hands great and are much better than any other products I have used. They also didn't need much breaking in. I would and will be recommending these to others!!!
customer_reviews.author: cesar

customer_reviews.title: Great color choices. GREAT protection.
customer_reviews.text: I would start by saying, as expected they are a bit stiff in the beginning, and may feel a bit weird when trying to get a solid purchase on a pull up bar, or when trying to do some cleans. However, after my third workout theyve conformed to my hand and has provided me with some fantastic protection. So far so good. will update this review after a couple of months putting them to the test.
customer_reviews.author: Josh j

customer_reviews.title: Best option I've found for Kettlebell training
customer_reviews.text: I love Kettlebell training but I work in an OR and I quickly learned that scrubbing into surgery several times per day with open calluses is no fun. I've tried 3 other types of gloves, this is the best option I've found so far. They start out a little stiff, but mine softened up pretty quick. They're much more comfortable when they do soften. My 2nd workout with them was a vO2 consisting of 600 snatches. I had no issues with the calluses tearing or blistering at all. My hands felt great!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lauer

customer_reviews.title: It's a game changer for CrossFit
customer_reviews.text: I purchases these and used them for the first time last night in my CrossFit class. For any bar work, these are a major improvement. My hands don't get destroyed and I can get more work done. Can't say anything about the quality yet but will update my review as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I do a solid 30 min kettlebell routine 4x a week. I have some pretty good callouses from lifting but they were getting raw with the kettlebells. In my first week using these gloves, I had some sore spots where my callouses are, but they weren't raw. In the second week, the gloves were a lot more pliable and I had good sized blisters on both hands by the end of the week. The gloves fit well, are comfortable and are easy to use with the kettlebells - but they did not protect my hands like I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: S. Boatman

customer_reviews.title: I have the BK two-hole grips and they are great but wanted the three-hole
customer_reviews.text: I have the BK two-hole grips and they are great but wanted the three-hole. Ordered the black and they stain my hands when I sweat. I emailed BK about the issue and the next day received email that a tan pair are on the way. Awesome customer service! I also have BK knee sleeves that are great. Awesome products and customer service, which is why I'll continue to buy BK products and why I recommend BK to my fellow CFers. This is how customers should be treated!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Good lifting hand grips
customer_reviews.text: I am really glad I got these 3 hole wrist grips for lifting in the gym as it protects my palms and hands from ripping or getting ruff spots from the bars and dumbbells. I wish I would have purchased them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Mack

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had them for three days and they seem to be good so far. Obviously I haven’t had the opportunity to really break them in yet and will update this post as they age. I’ve used them in one workout so far (CrossFit) and they did their job. Hopefully they last and become my favorite grips
customer_reviews.author: Ralph R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent products!!
customer_reviews.text: My Bear KompleX hand grips are awesome! Keeps my hands tight on kettle bell swings, pull-ups, etc. One of the trainers at my CrossFit gym, is going to purchase some!! I also purchased Bear KompleX 7mm knee sleeves, and they help tremendously. After 15 years of running, my knees snap, crackle, and pop! The knee sleeves help with air squats, squat lifts, really anything where I'm doing a lot of deep knee bends. Our trainer Jason, who used to compete competitively in powerlifting, uses the same ones! Quality of hand grips and knee sleeves is fantastic, and definitely made to last!! Thanks so much Nate and Jake!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A Warrington

customer_reviews.title: I would have happily exchanged them for a small and written a better ...
customer_reviews.text: I wore these grips ONCE. I measured according to the instructions and was right on the cusp between a small and a medium. After reading other reviews, I decided to follow the advice of others and go up a size and bought a medium. They appeared to be the right size when I tried them on, but were definitely bunching up and uncomfortable during my workout. I would have happily exchanged them for a small and written a better review, until I noticed that the rings that support the velcro on the wrist strips were completely rusty! After only one workout! I'm going to go with a different brand...
customer_reviews.author: RS312

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love the grip on the leather with these grips especially against the barbell. In addition, it has support around your wrist as well to make sure you have support in that area, especially when you add the chalk.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Orta

customer_reviews.title: Grip it and rip it
customer_reviews.text: The lifespan of a grip is only so long, however out of all the ones I've tried or tested. The 3 hole brown leather ones are the best and most comfortable. Will continue to be a repeat customer.
customer_reviews.author: WrestleToWin1st

customer_reviews.title: Just Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Mehhh... They are ok, but be warned the sizing in the chart is difficult. The first pair was so small my fingers wouldn’t even fit through the holes so I had to return and go up two sizes. Might be better to get them from a store.
customer_reviews.author: E.Contreras

customer_reviews.title: The leather grips are SLIPPERY!
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to “break in” these leather grips for almost two months to no avail. I may as well be wrapping my hands with silk because there is virtually no grip at all. Even with chalk. My hands slip every single time and I’ve even tried lifting using the grips to try to “break them in” more, and have rubbed them on concrete at one point, hoping to rough them up and increase their hold. I won’t be getting leather again and def don’t recommend this style.
customer_reviews.author: SarahBarker

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: As long time CrossFitter, I was used to my hands tearing. Not anymore!! These things are a lifesaver. I’ve done Bar Muscle Ups, pull up, toes to bar, etc with comfort! The leather adds more for grip. They slide on and off easily if you don’t like having them on for barbell movements in your WOD. I hope these last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gloves for a good price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair after I just couldn't take my hands getting destroyed from CrossFit. I've never been a person to use gloves or wraps of any sort before, but I just couldn't take it anymore. after browsing many products, these seemed like the best recommended wraps around, and I was not dissatisfied. granted they take a few workouts to break in, but once you do, they really can do wonders. recommend you get the appropriate size, but even if you do get them too big or small, the company is more than willing to help out. You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Torres

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far this product has held up to the description and previous reviews by purchasers. I ordered the largest size available because my hand measurement was right on the line between the largest and next size down. Would be interested to see how the smaller size would feel because at time it feels almost as if there's too much material between my hands and the bar. Overall though, they seem to work well. Time will tell how long they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: A. Balow

customer_reviews.title: ... out for two days and so far they look like they hold up
customer_reviews.text: I just got the bear claws Tuesday and tried them out for two days and so far they look like they hold up. It definitely protects my palm. Others say there's a break in period so I'm still experimenting with it. Overall a solid product and holds against everything I used it for.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Kayan Leung

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and nice quality
customer_reviews.text: These offer great support and seem to hold up for my crossfit needs. I'm a little concerned about the longevity of them but so far they are comfortable and with a little chalk are great.
customer_reviews.author: C. Neidenfeuhr

customer_reviews.title: Crossfit necessary product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hands been ripping from crossfit? Definite game changer! Felt funny since I have ALWAYS been delaying purchasing an equipment to workout with but I cannot live without these! I know its a bit pricey but to not rip your hands and be able to continually increase your performance? thats a hell yeah in my book! Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great for pull ups and deadlifts
customer_reviews.text: I really like these for doing pull ups and deadlifts. They fit nicely and I like the 3 hole concept. I've used them for many excersises and they are still going strong. The only issue I have with them is they aren't good for doing a clean type lift because when you bring the bar up to your chest the pad bunches up. This is the only complaint I have but I will always use these going forward until I find something better. However I don't see that happening. I really love these and I really don't give 5 stars unless something blows my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Big Even After Measuring
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for crossfit, and I have now used them for 4 workouts. They do protect your hands from ripping but I ordered according to the measurements and they are too big to where they pinch my hands when I hang from the bar, the leather folds up and makes it extremely uncomfortable. I have to move the straps way down my wrist which then makes it impossible for me to wear my apple watch which monitors my workout.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Stop your search...You have found the best grips.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, exactly what I was looking for in pull up grips. High quality leather holding up very well after a month of use. The wrist area is padded and very comfortable, no plastic buckle digging into your wrist like the standard 2 hole gymnastic grips. GET THESE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried everything imaginable and so far the best komplex has worked out the best for me. Not over bearing on pull ups and works great for my T2Bs.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable. Especially between the fingers. Had to cut some areas out to make them work but have leaving them in the car lately rather than actually using them. Quality is cheap and looks like they’re made in China.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: CrossFit must have
customer_reviews.text: Look everyone hats those pics ok Instagram of tearing up your hands. Just use these. They work great. Sizing can be tricky. I went smaller and I was glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Guptill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Had these about a weeks now and used them almost every training session so far. I did a bunch of Pull up work and workouts with more bar work like "Fran" and these feel great! They protect my hands and I have good grip as well. Also, unlike other gymnastic wraps I have used the strap/buckle doesn't dig into your wrist which is great!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Favorite grips
customer_reviews.text: Great grips! We have gone through a ton of different brands and kinds of grips and these are by far our favorite! They feel amazing, have reduced pain in my hands and minimized tearing!!!! I found my new favorite grips
customer_reviews.author: Kerianne

customer_reviews.title: I had higher hopes :/ maybe it's my small hands
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars because I'm indifferent! I love the concept and mission of the company but grips without finger holes seem to work better for me... I'm not sure if it's small hands or what but I found the finger holes to just create new and different irritation around the bases of my fingers since the holes and leather strips between the fingers are wide.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Makes a big difference on pull ups or toes to bar
customer_reviews.text: I had a fabric hand guard before, but these are 10 times better. No more pain on my palm where the skin used to pinch against the bar, I'm a big fan.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Price does not match quality.
customer_reviews.text: After 3-4 uses the strap rings are already rusting. Both grips are labeled “L”. The Velcro strap width is identical to the metal ring inner diameter making them a little challenging to get on. The finger holes don’t match the size (My fingers barely fit through the holes of my XL grips). Other than that, they work fine
customer_reviews.author: Ventiphoto

customer_reviews.title: spend the money.
customer_reviews.text: spend the money, they're worth it. they're actually a little "slick" on the pullup bar (w/ grip tape on it) the first time or two, but the surface roughens up after a few uses and you're golden. so if you notice this at first, dont fret. i was between a small and a medium and i went small, and am happy i did... i'd rather have these a little snug than a little loose.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great. Much much sturdier than my JAW grips - I have smaller hands so I was worried the leather would be too substantial/thick and my hands would get tired, but after 3+ workouts they are broken in and hands feel good. Straps are great and coverage down to the wrist is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of gymnastics grips
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of gymnastics grips. I ordered a size medium and I like them and I think probably could have sized up, despite being on the lower end of the size chart provided on their website. So far I've used the for chest to bar pullups and toes to bar, and they keep my hand from sliding at all around the bar and definitely make me feel more attached to the bar. I tried them for ring muscle ups and found that they're almost too sticky; they don't allow my hand to slide around the rings. The leather is surprisingly supple and seemed to wear in fairly quickly. I'm excited to see how they break in with further use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: did not disappoint me,but the price still not deserve
customer_reviews.text: I have paid attention to them for a some time, and I haven't bought them until now just because her high price. This time I bought them for my husband as a Valentine's Day gift. surely they did not disappoint me, including her pleasant smell, fashion style and easy to wear. But I still think they're not deserve more than double money to my used one which I bought from Amazon one month ago. all right then,anyway, Happy Valentine's Day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should have sized down
customer_reviews.text: Sizing is bigger than I expected I got a small and they bunch up in my creases I ended up just taking them off to finish the workout. I had ordered small
customer_reviews.author: Sierra N. Granger

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately still torn hands
customer_reviews.text: Still tearing my hands... I have tried these grips and their carbon grips and all still tear my hands even after breaking them in. I am an avid crossfitter and have basically a giant callous for both of my hands. I keep them cared for and shaved but these grips still make them tear...
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: I love these things
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. I’ve been crossfitting long enough to have tried it all. No matter what my hands kept ripping. I tried wodies, I tried rogue, I even tried shaving my calluses and nothing kept them from ripping until I got these babies. I highly recommend this product for anyone who is sick of taping hands or just hurting like crazy during a c2b or ttb workout!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Willc2018

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product. I’ve been doing CrossFit for about 5 months and my hand finally ripped during pull-ups. Very painful. Ordered another brand & sent them back. These r high quality & the felt type leather didn’t require breaking in. My pull-up & TTB grip is so much better & my palms are protected. In love!
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Teniente

customer_reviews.title: Great grips!
customer_reviews.text: Super durable. Not a big fan of grips but these are great because they are thin enough to get a feel for the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Buckman

customer_reviews.title: Love em, on my third pair
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has always hated grips, I love these grips, I can wear them during any workout without limiting my wrist range of motion. Some people give them a one star because it leaves your hands black (but c'mon, it's black leather and you're sweating, what do you expect). They make sure I don't rip so I'm satisfied. Only reason I knock it down a star is that my second pair ripped apart during a workout (approximately a year worth of use).
customer_reviews.author: D.Titus

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The 'right' size is still too big and the finger holes are too small. The wrist strap is too small, too. Basically, once they are on, they work, but I wouldn't buy them again because they are difficult to get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID PARKE

customer_reviews.title: Tried the rest,  these are best.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other grips from popular "top of search" brands, but these are the best. Don't waste your time on anything else. These grips felt great on the bar even in humid weather (when the bar itself sweats, aren't too thick (impacting your grip strength), and protected my already calloused/bruised palms from the first set to the last. I wouldn't have been able to complete the WOD without them. I donated my other grips to our lost and found in case someone in desperate need wants them. I'll be using these from now on.
customer_reviews.author: William

product_meta.title: Bear KompleX 3 Hole Leather Hand Grips for Home Workouts Like Pull-ups, Weightlifting, WODs with Wrist Straps, Comfort and Support, Hand Protection from Rips and Blisters for Men and Women
feature_bullets: 🏆CRUSH YOUR AT-HOME WORKOUTS: Bear KompleX genuine leather Hand Grips are the perfect gloves for you to knock out your workout. You have a 2-Hole & 3-Hole option to protect your palms. The Grips are breathable and designed with an adjustable wrist strap for optimal comfort and support. Choose a color option that matches your style.

💪DURABLE QUADRUPLE STITCHING will ensure full support and stability when using the Bear KompleX gymnastics grips. Enjoy the stronger & longer hold on the bar! These gloves will NOT dig into your wrist or open up during use. You shouldn't have to worry about your hands when dominating your WOD!

📈MEASURE CORRECTLY: To ensure you get the best out of your Hand Grips, make sure to measure your hands and ring size following the instructions in the image block. If you are between sizes or prefer a loose fit with a fold, go up in size. We are so confident you will love our Bear KompleX products, that if your expectations are not met for any reason, we will refund you within 60-days of purchase.

💯SUPERIOR LEATHER WILL REDUCE SLIPPING: on the bar and allow you to keep banging those pull-ups out. Great for the speal bar as well! Protect your hands and palms during Pull-ups, Chest to bar, Muscle ups, Toes to Bar (T2B), Knees to Elbow (K2E), Kettlebell swings, Power lifting, Power Cleans, Deadlifts, Snatches, Gymnastics, and more…

🙌DOMINATE EFFECTIVELY: Enjoy a FREE Carabiner grip clip included to make sure your pair of Grips never gets lost! AND BONUS Road Workout PDF to keep your fitness game on top while on the go. Be sure to look at the special offer section below check for discounts on ALL Bear KompleX products.
